items.content:
Remote iOS Tech Lead | £70,000 | Surrey

Swift/UIKit/CoreData/Objective C

Job Summary

My client is an exciting tech firm that builds high performance mobile applications for a number of international clients, spanning over 70 countries. Due to growth, they are looking to bring on a talented iOS Tech Lead to join their exisiting team.

This role is open for a talented iOS Developer to work on a fully remote basis, albeit you would be required on site in Surrey for the occasional team or client meeting.

The main responsibility for the role will be to ensure the smooth delivery of iOS projects for external clients, starting from working with stakeholders and requirement taking, to the delivery of the final project. The Tech Lead will be responsible for overseeing projects and working to help other members of the team with technical guidance.

This role provides the opportunity to work on projects for a number of renowned brands with a highly talented team. My client looks to provide a great team culture and benefits packages, which includes flexible working hours and the option for unlimited holiday.

Key Skills

- Experience with coding in Swift for iOS

- Knowledge of iOS Frameworks such as UIKit, CoreDate, Corelocation etc

- Experience of working with third party librairies and API

- Some knowledge RxSwift

- Some knowledge of Objective C

- Working experience of CI/CD

Further Information

If you'd like further information about the role, please get in touch with Tom Farrington at Premier IT.

Be aware that the Tech Lead would be required to be based in the UK and there is no visa sponsorship available

SpringboardVR

Lead Android / Unity Developer

verified
Worldwide
SpringboardVR is the fastest growing Virtual Reality arcade management platform outside of China, and we are looking to expand our development team! Our development team is currently 9 people located across 5 countries working in PHP, Go, C#, and Javascript. Because we are a small team everyone has a chance to take ownership over different projects and products with control over all the technical decisions on how things get built. We love trying new things! This is a full time contract position for 40 hours a week. We are unable to provide any Visa sponsorship. This is a fully remote position and we are a fully remote company! Our current development team is located across the Americas, Europe, and South Korea. We are open to someone in any timezone, with a preference to North America and Europe. # Responsibilities We are looking to bring on a developer to lead our Android and Unity projects at SpringboardVR. This position will be very self directed and we are definitely looking for someone who is a self starter and is able to take any task and own it from start to finish. You will be developing an Android based MDM software and will work closely with our backend API developers. You will also be working on VR based Unity projects for Android VR headsets. # Requirements * Android Development Experience (Kotlin or Java) * Unity Development Experience * Can handle constructive criticism * Self directed **Nice to Haves** * Experience working with a fully remote team * MDM Development Experience * Experience with other languages - C#, Go #Salary $104,000 #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
Chapter Lead Mobile (m/f/d)

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Mobile Apps Developer
Skills:
  • Application Development
  • Mobile Web Design

    • Intro

    We are a dynamic, successful, and fast growing FinTech company based in Berlin, that aims to making savings and investments digitally accessible to improve customer benefit. Our goal is to provide customers all over Europe with simple, secure, and profitable savings and investment products without barriers. We have received more than €195 million in funding from well-known investors including Thrive Capital, Ribbit Capital, Index Ventures, Yuri Milner, Tom Stafford and PayPal.
    Raisin has been very successful over the last few years at delighting it’s customers through enabling deposits and investments without barriers across the EU. 
    Your mission as an experienced Leader & React Native Developer is to enable teams to build great solutions with delighting UI’s and an amazing mobile user experience. Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

    Your responsibilities:

    • You are Chapter lead, with accountability for the improvement of our overall mobile engineering capability, including talent, workflows and tools
    • You are Key contributor in a cross-functional mobile team
    • You are a hands-on team lead and mentor
    • You ensure a high working morale, teamspirit, and productivity
    • You develop both your chapter’s soft- and technical skill-set according to the company goals and needs
    • You coach your chapter to remove obstacles independently, but you also get your hands dirty, when needed
    • You are a role model and inspire your chapter to live our principles of customer-centric innovation, entrepreneurship and responsibility
    • You are a key contributor to an efficient development environment and optimal workflows for the whole engineering organization
    • You are a great communicator and empathetic motivator when needed 

    Main requirements

     Your profile:

    • You bring at least 3 years of leadership experience
    • You know how to manage software projects to a successful delivery in collaborative way
    • Entrepreneurial mind-set and the ability to guide teams towards a common goal in a fast-paced international environment
    • You have strong experience (3y)  with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcases your experience
    • You have a deep understanding of the app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews
    • You are an open-minded and creative team player enjoying constructive code and architecture discussions
    • Writing clean, maintainable and well documented code comes naturally - we strongly believe in the power of clean code
    • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) experience is a plus
    • Fluency in English, German language skills are a plus though not mandatory 
     
    Our benefits:

     Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. We are professional and work hard to always be the best in our field. You find us in our open office in beautiful Prenzlauer Berg well connected to public transport and surrounded by a great variety of restaurants and supermarkets.

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,500 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.title: Senior Android Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=10, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=5, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Android Developer at Polarr

Remote | International

SAN JOSE, CA; SHENZHEN, CHINA; BEIJING, CHINA; BARCELONA, SPAIN OR REMOTE

ENGINEERING

FULL TIME

Polarr is looking for a Senior Android developer who’re familiar with video processing as well as knowledge of Tensorflow to bring new interactive A.I. experiences to modern applications.

You Have:

  • Architected and built standalone apps with custom UI elements from scratch
  • Worked with animation frameworks where you can smoothly animate elements and transform them following complex design requirements
  • Implemented test driven design and accomplished high test coverage for applications you’ve written
  • Dealt with low end device development where you optimized RAM performance and UI rendering frame rate

You Will:

  • Work on complex video and image processing apps with high memory footprint and CPU usage.
  • Exploring and implementing AI related user features using CoreML and other AI frameworks
  • Engineer video and image processing engines that help Polarr users make sophisticated visual effects
  • Implement UI/UX design elements
  • Experimenting with CoreML AI modules and integrating them with the application experience
  • Optimizing app launch speed and performance for lower RAM and CPU usage and reducing crashes

You Are:

  • Considerate of how your code will interface with future versions of Android (forward’s compatibility)
  • Architecture first rather than jumping into writing implementation code
  • Aware of the latest nuances of Android frameworks and understand how to make them backwards compatible with older devices
  • Obsessed with the details, imperfections, no matter how small, are cause for concern
  • User experience driven, the positive experience of the user plays a big part in what you do.
  • Learn more about our values, mission and team at our careers page!
  • Take a look at To Prospective Team Members of Polarr, a short blog written by our co-founders for even more info.
  • Benefits and perks: https://www.notion.so/polarr/Company-Perks-03664102040348dfa8da7c4c65deec6c

Our Mission: To enable and inspire everyone to make beautiful creations.

What is Polarr?:

Polarr is building the world’s largest knowledge base of visual effect, with a mission to enable and inspire everyone to make beautiful creations. Over the last 4 years, our company built a unique ecosystem of visual effects creators and developers such as Samsung, OPPO, Western Digital where millions of visual effects are shared and used every month.

Apply for job

items.content:
Lead Remote Android / Unity Developer

DESCRIPTION

SpringboardVR is the fastest growing Virtual Reality arcade management platform outside of China, and we are looking to expand our development team! Our development team is currently 9 people located across 5 countries working in PHP, Go, C#, and Javascript. Because we are a small team everyone has a chance to take ownership over different projects and products with control over all the technical decisions on how things get built. We love trying new things!


We are looking to bring on a developer to lead our Android and Unity projects at SpringboardVR. This position will be very self directed and we are definitely looking for someone who is a self starter and is able to take any task and own it from start to finish. You will be developing an Android based MDM software and will work closely with our backend API developers. You will also be working on VR based Unity projects for Android VR headsets.


This is a full time contract position for 40 hours a week. We are unable to provide any Visa sponsorship.


This is a fully remote position and we are a fully remote company! Our current development team is located across the Americas, Europe, and South Korea.


We are open to someone in any timezone, with a preference to North America and Europe.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Android Development Experience (Kotlin or Java)
  • Unity Development Experience
  • Can handle constructive criticism
  • Self directed


Nice to Haves
  • Experience working with a fully remote team
  • MDM Development Experience
  • Experience with other languages - C#, Go

BENEFITS
This is a full time contractor position with the possibility of becoming a salaried employee in the future for U.S. citizens.
  • Salary between $25 and $50 per hour
  • Working 40 hours a week with no overtime, we value work/life balance!
  • Paid every 2 weeks
  • Initially a 3 month trial period contract followed by a 1 year contract
  • Fully remote team

Apply now

items.title: Android Developer (Omvana Meditation App)

items.content:
Android Developer (Omvana Meditation App)

Be part of the team that is expanding the #1 Meditation App in Over 30 Countries with over 1.5M Downloads while working in an international team of 55+ countries and making an impact on the world through great tech products. All, while enjoying the amazing lifestyle that only South East Asia can provide you.  

About the Role

Omvana is Mindvalley’s baby, first created in 2013. It became the World’s #1 Meditation App in Over 30 Countries with over 1.5M downloads. It is a project born out of a crazy idea, allowing people to mix their meditations with different sounds as a fun and engaging way to retain people on one of the world’s most ancient, healthy and effective mindfulness practices.

That crazy idea was nurtured and it soon became worthy of the attention of the most remarkable publications out there, from  to renomated newspapers such as   on the health field like  and resulting in more than 29,000 mentions through the internet. But more than our numbers, we are proud of the positive impact Omvana has caused on hundreds of thousands of lives, and now, we intend to expand this project and reach the hundreds of millions. 

And we are looking for smart people, like you, to help us achieve this goal. 

Being one of our developers, you'll have an opportunity to learn and grow your technical as well as personal skills. The ability to write performant and clean code with great attention to detail is essential, but you will be part of something bigger than building features. We hope you are interested because we want you to: 

  • Participate in the product creation working closely with UX designers and Product Managers; 
  • Ensure performance, quality and responsiveness;
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs;
  • Be open to learn and share knowledge with the team;
  • Contribute. From code architecture to product features to visual designs; 

You are more than just a developer, someone who understands that a great app must do great things yet is simple and intuitive. You are pixel-perfect, knowing that a pixel to the right is not merely a pixel to the right. You understand that an organised code with the well-applied design patterns will make a difference. You are fascinated about technology and eager to learn everything you can, applying the coolest and most amazing techniques there are. You add a "magic touch" that will dazzle your users.

 Requirements

  • Java, Android framework, Gradle
  • Kotlin is strongly preferred
  • Experience with clean architecture and MVVM
  • Experience with Dependency Injections
  • Experience with Rx
  • Writing Unit Test Cases is a must
  • Team player attitude
  • Good communication skills
  • In addition to having excellent technical skills, you have a keen interest in the latest technologies and have a feel for user experience
  • Practical understanding of Continuous Integration and Delivery

Have you worked on any Android app? Include your portfolio in your resume!

On the personal side

  • Interested in personal development, meditation, health & fitness or related topics 
  • Great logic and problem solving skills
  • Effective communication skills
  • You feel comfortable (and enjoy) working outside your comfort zone
  • Be a team player, willing to do whatever is necessary to deliver a great product

This position requires you to be initially, physically located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and remote working is possible but limited and according to the team’s needs. We want you close because what we want and offer is the understanding of the big picture where you can see how what you are developing impact the metrics and the business.

Apply now

  • Proven track record of always learning and growing
  • Proactive attitude
  • Possess a spirit of generosity

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc...
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to learn new skills together in study groups, join clubs (photography, gaming, etc.) and get free camera equipment/games/conferences/courses/massages/etc., charitable fundraisers, fitness & yoga programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.
  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. 

Apply now

items.title: Lead Application Engineer - SwiftUI, Combine, Architecture, Data Model at LiveSurface
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=17, mobile=52, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=37, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Lead Application Engineer - SwiftUI, Combine, Architecture, Data Model

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Advertising, Graphic Design, Visual Effects
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: LiveSurface | No office location

Technologies

swift
uikit
swiftui
objective-c
combine

Job description

LiveSurface is an industry leader in visualization and image creation tools for creatives. We blend leading technology with hand-curated content to provide realtime photorealistic visualization to our users. At our heart, we are a team of creatives that thrive on transforming challenging problems into beautifully implemented solutions.

We are seeking a talented lead application engineer to join our team and help us to build the next generation of LiveSurface products. Interested in joining us? We’d love to hear from you.

Lead Application Engineer

What you’ll do:
_ Build the next generation of LiveSurface visualization products.
_ Leverage the latest frameworks (SwiftUI, Combine, Swift 5.x) to build new products.
_ Work with the team to build a product roadmap and define milestones.
_ Plan and research best technologies, pulling primarily from Apple Frameworks.
_ Contribute to the overall product vision.
_ Architect clean, reusable and maintainable modules.
_ Work tightly with render engine lead to integrate and influence the render engine design.
_ Refactor, optimize and pull from existing code from LiveSurface frameworks.
_ Deliver beautiful, well implemented code that is performant and easy to understand.

Who you are:
_ A university graduate with an undergraduate degree or better.
_ An experienced engineer with a minimum of 5 years working on UI code.
_ A fast learner, able to adapt to new frameworks quickly.
_ Experienced in creating iOS/macOS applications using Xcode.
_ Up-to-date with the latest frameworks.
_ Fluent in Swift, Objective-C and Apple Frameworks.
_ Experienced in using Apple Frameworks to create custom experiences.
_ An English speaker with strong communication skills.
_ Equally good at architecting as you are with refactoring.
_ Obsessed with clean, reusable modular architecture.
_ Focused on workflow and user experience.

We offer:
_ Remote work and a flexible schedule.
_ A wide range of challenging problems to solve.
_ A stable, revenue-based structure with an existing product (on the market for 5+ years).
_ Broad exposure: Your work will be seen and loved by thousands of users.
_ A highly acclaimed platform with a loyal user base.
_ A small, friendly, engineering team.
_ Product-focused, non-corporate management.

Extras that will make you stand out:
_ A background in graphics and gaming.
_ Knowledge of C, C++.
_ Experience with using Adobe and other industry standard graphics tools.

More about Context:
http://www.livesurface.com/context.php


Apply now

About LiveSurface

LiveSurface was founded by an Apple alum designer/entrepreneur with 25+ years in the branding and design fields and 10+ years software engineering on macOS/iOS platforms.

Our small, talented team is distributed and lives in California, New York, Spain, Israel, Portugal, Germany. We love challenging problems and creating beautifully implemented solutions. We are split about evenly between engineering and content/marketing.

Our current customers include boutique design studios, well-know advertising/design agencies and some of the biggest names in Silicon Valley.

Benefits

  • Remote work
  • Flexible schedule
  • Nice people
  • Collaborative workflow
  • Product-focused approach

More than 40,000 service calls per day clearly make our client one of Europe’s leading organization in this market and prove, that if things need fixing, they’ll provide a solution. From telecommunications and IT to security & safety installations, smart building technologies and POS devices – its more than 8,000 service engineer will find solutions for new technologies. The company offers full service human and technical support to help its customers with new technologies, relying on its network of engineers around Europe for on-site interventions (installation and maintenance) and provides logistics and call center support with its back-office teams.

    We are looking for a qualified Mobile developer to join our Engineering team. 
     
    As a Mobile developer, you’ll collaborate with internal teams to develop functional mobile applications, while working in a fast-paced environment. 
     
    Ultimately, you should be able to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications.

items.content:
Android Developer at Lookback

Remote | International

Lookback is a cash flow positive, remote-first, SaaS startup from Stockholm, with headquarters in Palo Alto. We are hiring a senior Android developer to rewrite our Video/WebRTC recording app (and beyond).

We have a functioning Android app, but it needs a full rewrite to:

  • Improve stability. Lookback is known for being rock-solid, and our Android app needs to up the game.
  • Prepare for the future. We have product developments to push into the app further down the line.
  • Great Android “feel”. The app should showcase a strong Android UI experience.

To do this, we need you to have lots of experience in developing Android apps. We like Kotlin and functional reactive programming, but are open to pushing the envelope. We extensively use Video and WebRTC technologies: some experience in that is good, but we also have in-house devs in this area to guide you.

Our Android app works, but our current developer has shifted priorities, hence we want to recruit.

We offer competitive salaries, stock options, a 401(k) with a 4% match, health insurance that is 100% covered by us, and 30 days of vacation per year which we expect you to use.

We have a small but highly competent team of engineers and a hands-off management culture. And we love building tech.

The position will be based remote in Europe or North America.

Apply for job

items.content:
Ionic Mobile Developer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

mobile
android
ios
ionic

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is seeking a Mobile Developer who has a strong background in Ionic to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient mobile applications. You will also be instrumental in driving our mobile technology roadmap forward and evangelizing mobile development and testing practices. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with mobile development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Ionic framework experience required
  • Ionic Pro experience
  • Strong JavaScript coding experience
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies* Minimum 3 years of cumulative mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience with technology experience from at least one of the following areas:
  • Server-side/Middleware (REST API services, microservices)
  • Native Applications (iOS, Android)
Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.title: IOS Developer-Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=21, mobile=34, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=20, java=11, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
This is a 100% Remote role.?

Our client?s app is reaching millions and is at the top of the iOS and Play Store.? Their purpose is to help people feel close and they strive to create an environment where their people are inspired to do their best work.

They work in a distributed, remote small team and strive for a positive, enjoyable environment where everyone enjoys coming (remotely) work.?? This is a 100% remote position with occasional travel to spend time with your teammates and to plan for the business. ?

We're looking for a thoughtful and creative Senior Mobile Engineer to join our team. You are someone who feels pride from writing solid code. You enjoy creating new user experiences and solving fun technical problems. You delight in making a difference for millions of people in the world and you care about having a joyful work environment.

Technical Skills:
  • 4+ years of IOS experience.? Deep experience in the IOS Stack ? Swift / Objective-C.?
  • Team Lead / Architect experience is a big plus.?
  • Experience with C / C++ would give you a head start on our code base.
  • Experience with lower level challenges.? Enjoys technical challenges and building without using frameworks
You will:
  • Collaborate with teammates to implement and launch highly visible, user-facing features from start to finish
  • Produce solid quality code, raising the bar for the whole team on quality and speed
  • Work with one or more of Swift, ObjectiveC, Java, Kotlin, C++ and/or Python
You may be a fit if you:
  • Communicate with empathy
  • Would excel in a small, lean startup environment.
  • Understand the business and how your technical contributions contribute to the bigger picture.
  • Have founded your own company before
  • Remain calm and even-keeled, especially in a storm
  • Have effective interpersonal, communication, and collaboration skills to work successfully in a 100% remote team environment
  • Enjoy reverse engineering from inputs and outputs of black-box systems
  • Pride yourself on strong foundation in computer science, data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Are humble and intellectually curious
This is a permanent position for a California?based client.?

We can not sponsor or consider?C2C for this role

Mobile Development, IOS, Android

items.content:
We are currently working exclusively with a pioneering Mobile - Tech start up with over £10m in funding looking for a remote Android Developer - Kotlin, Java.

The Remote Android Developer - Kotlin, Java will be working with an established and successful mobile development based in central London looking to disrupt the way we essentially use our mobiles.

An exciting opportunity to join a fast scaling technology start up which you can make a positive impact within.

Key technical requirements:
*2 years + in Android Development
*Understanding of the mobile development lifecycle
*Good knowledge of Agile Processes
*Android SDK
*Kotlin / Java development

Please note, that this role would ideally based within the UK or mainland Europe so that it is easily accessible to the UK when needed which will be expected to be quarterly and will require full working rights in the UK.

Propel are the UK's largest independent provider of permanent and contract recruitment services to the global digital economy, specialising in commercial, marketing, technical and creative talent.

Services advertised by Propel are those of an Agency and/or an Employment Business. Please be aware that we receive a high volume of applications for our roles, many from people who meet or exceed the requirements. Whilst we try to respond to as many applicants as possible, you can assume that you have not been selected for interview if you do not hear from us within 14 days.

In this full-time, remote, fast-paced and challenging role, you will:Work alongside talented co-founders on this billion-dollar and growing startupDesign and build advanced applications for the Android platformCollaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new featuresWork with outside data sources and APIsUnit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliabilityWork on bug fixing and improving application performanceContinuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
RequirementsAbility to live without a salary up to 1 year3-9 years of proven work experience as a Software Developer and Android DeveloperBS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subjectA deep understanding of the Android framework, Kotlin and Java programming languagesKnowledge of algorithms, data structures, and software engineering practicesExperience with Git, GitHub and Android StudioExperience with Firebase products (e.g. Firestore, FCM, etc.)Experience working with remote data via REST and JSONExperience with third-party libraries and APIsWorking knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologiesSolid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.Ability to write clean and scalable/modular codeExperience with MVVM design pattern and Android JetpackWorking knowledge of RxJava and CoroutinesStrong OOP experienceTeam spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with teammatesGood time-management skillsPrior remote working experience strongly desiredFluency in written and spoken EnglishProven ability to work autonomously and stay self-motivatedThe ability to take ownership and see working at a startup as a lifestyle - A startup mindsetWillingness to put money into the startup is a plus
BenefitsMarket competitive salary and significant equity in a billion-dollar and growing startupTop-notch benefits (healthcare, vision, dental, maternity, paternity, retirement)Unlimited paid time offCommuter benefitsOngoing learning through mentorship and education budgetRemote work when needed and work on a flexible scheduleWorkplace perks like food/coffeeDog-friendly officeTeam bonding and off-site eventsWork with an exceptional team of bright, innovative, fun and ambitious individualsAnd much more!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=16, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=7, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
As the lead Android developer, you will be responsible for leading all aspects of Android development. You will be building applications connecting people with IoT products. The ideal candidate will be comfortable leading a team of junior to mid-level developers. You should be comfortable meeting with clients to discuss project details and help them define application requirements when needed. We're looking for individuals with strong UX intuition who care about building software that meaningfully connects people with products.
Responsibilities:
Develop native Android applications and frameworks focused on wireless connectivity and control using Kotlin and/or JavaClear documentation and communication of resultsDefine and implement robust app architectures and complex user interfacesMeet with clients by phone, web conferencing and in person when necessaryEstimates, organizes and documents tasksCreate development schedules or help to define development tasks and task timelinesCommunicate and justify design decisions with managementCollaborate with designers, engineers and product managers to build great productsProvide on-site training for VIP clients
Qualifications:
Proficiency with git requiredProficiency with common mobile development design patterns such as MVVMExperience with offline storage, threading and performance tuningStrong communication skills with an interest in helping educate others3+ years developing Native Android applications using Java or KotlinExperience with Bluetooth Low Energy, Wi-Fi, Low Power Cellular and other wireless technologies strongly desired but not requiredExperience with Bluetooth Mesh a big plusFirm understanding and proven history of the application of key software design principles such as separation of concerns, high cohesion, and low coupling to facilitate reuse and maintainability in software architectures, designs, and implementations; ability to decompose large, complex software systems into manageable subsystems with clearly defined interfacesEmbedded development experience highly desirable but not requiredUnderstanding of test-driven development and agile methodologies a plusBachelors or master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related discipline desired but equivalent experience will also be accepted

We are looking for a developer to take ownership and complete development of our custom authentication system that will work alongside firebase. The auth has been started and is written in Groovy and uses Micronaut framework & MySQL.
Remote work is ok. This position is a contract position.

Skills And QualificationsStrong knowledge of Groovy, Java, MySQL and Micronaut frameworkUnderstanding authentication system design & securityStrong knowledge of API DevelopmentExperience with firebase and twilio APIsUnderstanding accessibility and security complianceUnderstanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable applicationUser authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environmentsIntegration of multiple data sources and databases into one systemExperience with Google Cloud PlatformFirebase, Swift, and React development experiece is a huge plus

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=30, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=24, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
iOS Developer

REMOTE

3 openings

The ideal candidate will have experience building iOS applications (Swift) that rely on multiple web services and that operate at scale (millions of users), as well as home automation devices and wireless mesh networks (e.g. ZigBee and Z-Wave), and have a strong bias for clean, reusable code, testability and automation.

What you will do as an iOS Developer:

  • 3+ years of experience creating native iOS applications.
  • Familiarity with common iOS languages and libraries like Swift, RxSwift.
  • Extensive hands-on experience creating custom UI controls, designing protocols, implementing interfaces, and performance optimization.
  • Working knowledge of web services & REST APIs.
  • Ability to think critically and independently.
  • A strong passion for learning and adapting to new technologies.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

What you will bring to the table as an iOS Developer:

- Experience working with IoT frameworks or platforms.

- Knowledge of source control and code review systems (Github, Gerrit)

- Ability to effectively communicate technical challenges and solutions

- Experience with automating workflows for software development builds and deployments

- provided by Dice

items.title: Lead Graphics Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=7, mobile=16, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=8, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
LiveSurface

Lead Graphics Engineer

LiveSurface is an industry leader in visualization and image creation tools for creatives. We blend leading technology with hand-curated content to provide realtime photorealistic visualization to our users. At our heart, we are a team of creatives that thrive on transforming challenging problems into beautifully implemented solutions. We are seeking a talented graphics lead engineer to join our team and help us to build the next generation of LiveSurface products. Interested in joining us? We’d love to hear from you. Lead Graphics Engineer What you’ll do: _ Build the next generation of LiveSurface visualization products. _ Work with the team to build a product roadmap and define milestones. _ Plan and research best graphics technologies. _ Assess and develop AR/VR applications. _ Contribute to the overall product vision. _ Architect clean, reusable and maintainable modules. _ Leverage the latest frameworks to build new products. _ Work tightly with application lead to integrate and influence the UI design. _ Refactor, optimize and pull from existing code from LiveSurface frameworks. _ Deliver beautiful, well implemented code that is performant and easy to understand. Who you are: _ A university graduate with an undergraduate degree or better. _ An experienced engineer with a minimum of 5 years working on graphics code. _ A fast learner, able to adapt to new frameworks quickly. _ Experienced with a deep background in graphics and gaming. _ Experienced in creating graphics or rendering software (as games or pro tools). _ An expert in C, C++. _ Up-to-date with the latest graphics frameworks. _ An English speaker with strong communication skills. _ Equally good at architecting as you are with refactoring. _ Obsessed with clean, reusable modular architecture. _ Focused on workflow and user experience. We offer: _ Remote work and a flexible schedule. _ A wide range of challenging problems to solve. _ A stable, revenue-based structure with an existing product (on the market for 5+ years). _ Broad exposure: Your work will be seen and loved by thousands of users. _ A highly acclaimed platform with a loyal user base. _ A small, friendly, engineering team. _ Product-focused, non-corporate management. Extras that will make you stand out: _ Experience in Swift, Objective-C and Apple Frameworks. _ Experience with using Adobe and other industry standard graphics tools. More about Context: http://www.livesurface.com/context.php

items.content:
Waymap is on its way to deliver a pioneering navigation for people with special needs.


We are looking to hire a London home-based iOS Developer with minimum a year experience.


Start is within days/weeks.


The ideal candidate has worked on MapKit and Accessibility with focus on audio.  The app has been validated by users on a number of trials.  We are looking to expand the functionality of the current app to cover for additional users' needs.


We are working with SWIFT 4 and we welcome the effort to move the app to SWIFT 5.

items.title: Remote Senior Mobile Developer (Android/iOS)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=16, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=8, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are hiring a Senior Mobile Developer (Android/iOS) for a 12-month remote project. In this role, you will be hands-on developing mobile applications along with providing technical leadership and guidance across digital home client mobile applications. You will be required to think critically to solve problems in novel and optimal ways in order to deliver exceptional customer experiences. You will work alongside a large multi-tier team including other mobile client application engineers, as well as platform API and embedded hardware engineers, designers, testers, product managers and business managers. The ideal candidate will have solid experience developing native client applications in a corporate environment on iOS or Android and will be used to work in Agile teams in a contributive environment while being highly productive independently. What you need:
  • 4+ years of experience in developing native client applications on iOS and/or Android.
  • A verifiable grasp of Data Structures and Algorithms
  • Understanding of the HTTP protocol
  • Experience managing software projects with source control systems such as GitHub
  • A strong sense of ownership and responsibility for code quality following best practices
  • A strong passion for learning and adapting to new technologies
  • Ability to work collaboratively with a team as well as being independent and proactive.
Plus:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science
  • Proven experience building consumer-facing mobile applications with millions of users
  • Experience in caching in HTTP compliant caches
  • Experience maintaining Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines/workflows
  • Experience working with Internet-of-things frameworks or platforms (SmartThings, Nest, AWS IOT, etc.)
  • Experience with micro-services architectures and development leveraging AWS
  • Experience with Agile/Scrum
  • DevOps experience
- provided by Dice

items.content:
Team Lead Front-End

Company: Raisin
Location: Berlin, DE
Level: Senior
Language: English
Full-stack Developer
Skills:
  • fullstack
  • JavaScript
  • React
  • Team Leadership

    • Intro

    For further development and expansion of our successful business, Raisin is looking for highly motivated, smart and driven front end engineering team lead to complement our team in Berlin. 

    • Lead and mentor of a team of front end engineers

    • You ensure a high working morale, team-spirit and productivity

    • You develop your team’s soft- and technical skill-set according to the company goals and needs

    • You coach your team to remove roadblocks out of the way on its own but can also contribute when required

    • You are a role model and inspire your chapter to live our principles of customer-centric innovation, entrepreneurship and responsibility.

    • You are a key contributor to an efficient development environment and optimal workflows for the whole engineering organisation

    • You are a great communicator and motivator at all times

    Main requirements

    • You bring at least 3 years of leadership experience and are a hands-on team lead and mentor

    • You know how to manage software projects to a successful delivery in a collaborative way

    • Entrepreneurial mind-set and the ability to guide teams towards a common goal in a fast-paced international environment

    • Strong hands-on experience (5 years) as Front-End/Full-stack developer and advanced knowledge of software development lifecycle

    • You are an open minded team player who enjoys participating in constructive code and architecture discussions

    • Writing clean, maintainable and well documented code comes naturally - we strongly believe in the power of clean code

    • Fluency in English, German language skills are a plus though not mandatory

    • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) experience is a plus

    Perks

    Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. 

    • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
    • Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days
    • Free choice of hardware
    • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate 
    • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
    • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days 
    • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month 
    • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
    • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

items.title: iOS Developer (REMOTE)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=4, mobile=52, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=36, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About us1 Second Everyday is a video diary app that makes it easy to create the movie of your life. In a couple of minutes, parents can relive the first year of their child's life, look back at their last family vacation, or see their entire journey together. It gives anyone the power to reflect on school, friends, projects, and adventures. From our humble Kickstarter beginnings, we've grown into an award-winning app with millions of downloads.
About the iOS Developer positionWe are a small but growing company looking for an iOS Developer to join our 100% distributed team. You will be an integral part of our iOS team and will work with our product design team on projects. As youll be joining a small iOS team, you will help define our culture. Including automated testing, code reviews, and pair programming.

The details:This is a full-time, remote position. Were offering between $72,000-$123,000 USD per year for this role based on your experience and cost of ********* share options or equity.This position requires travel to our semi-annual retreats (Last one was Peru and allowed families to come too!).
iOS Developer responsibilities:Drive software development in many parts of our iOS app including new features, fixing bugs, refactoring, etc.Write well-designed, testable, and efficient codeFaithfully implement UI designs (with the understanding that it's a 2-way dialogue)Make an app that is a good citizen of the iOS platform by embracing OS features and UI conventionsWork with our support team to help explain and resolve problems as they arise
iOS Developer requirements:Experience working on a distributed teamAbility to work well with other people and communicate professionallyWillingness to help others learn and grow without judgementExcellent written and verbal communication skills in EnglishProficiency with git3+ years of experience building and shipping native iOS appsExpert knowledge of Swift and at least some knowledge of Objective-C (we have about a 5:1 ratio of Swift to Objective-C)Experience with technical writing such as documentation and specificationsShare and embody our company valuesTravel to our semi-annual retreats
Bonus skills & attributes:Experience with XCTest or other automated testing frameworksExperience with unidirectional data flow architecture like ReSwift (or Redux from the web world)Have used 1 Second Everyday.
Benefits & perks:Paid open vacation policy - We offer a MINIMUM of 2 weeks off each year. This isn't a vague policy where open vacation means no vacation.Healthcare benefits (currently only available in the United ************* Bonus - $500 per year for a NO WORK vacation on your anniversary.Wellness Bonus - $50 a month for a gym membership, yoga class, book club, or whatever makes you happy.2 weeks paid parental leave.Conferences of your choice.
Why work at 1SE?Travel the world for our semi-annual paid retreats (Last one was Peru and allowed families to come too!)You'd join our 100% distributed team - we value autonomy and flexible lifestyles.We're a diverse team across 6 countries, 5 languages, and 7 time-zones (First remote-baby for us!)You would work on an award-winning and beloved product with a diverse community around the world!Help continue our story.
We are an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse team and welcome all walks of life. 1 Second Everyday is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We dont discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.We are continuously expanding our hiring capabilities in other geographies. However, at this time we are unable to hire employees and contractors who reside and have to be paid in the specified countries below:ArgentinaBrazilCrimeaChinaCubaEgyptFranceIraqIranItalyJapanNigeriaNorth KoreaSpainSudanSwedenSyriaWe encourage you to continue to check back with future postings as we continue to expand our operational abilities in these countries.
Don't think this position is the right fit? Check out our other open positions!

items.content:
Position: iOS Developer -Remote

Position Type: Direct Hire/Full Time (US Citizen or Green Card Holder)

Position Location: Dallas, TX

Position Details: We are looking for an iOS developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablet computers. Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

Responsibilities:
  • Design and build applications for the iOS platform
  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization


Why Kelly ?

With Kelly, you-ll have direct connections to leading IT organizations in the best companies around the globe-offering you the chance to work on some of today-s most intriguing, innovative and high-visibility projects. In a field where change is the only constant, our connections and opportunities will help you take your career exactly where you want to go. We work with 95 of the Fortune 100- companies, and more than 3,000 IT hiring managers turn to us each year to access the best talent: people like you.

Last year we found 8,000 opportunities for IT professionals. Let us help advance your career today.

About Kelly Services

As a workforce advocate for over 70 years, we are proud to directly employ nearly 500,000 people around the world and have a role in connecting thousands more with work through our global network of talent suppliers and partners. Revenue in 2017 was $5.4 billion. Visit kellyservices.com and connect with us on Facebook , LinkedIn and Twitter .

Kelly Services is an equal opportunity employer including, but not limited to, Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, Protected Veterans, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity and is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Equal Employment Opportunity is The Law.

Category: IT/Software Development
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=22, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=10, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Android Developer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

android
java
mobile

Job description

Clevertech is seeking an Android Developer to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient applications. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with Android development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You will work on apps that are top 100s in their category in the store.

You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Must have apps on the app store with over 100 reviews
  • 5+ years of production-level software development experience
  • Strong design and coding skills (Java/Android)
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, a related field or equivalent work experience
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.title: Software Engineering Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Your Mission


Luno is a leading global cryptocurrency company operating across more than 40 countries and with offices in London, Singapore and Cape Town. We’re Series B-funded and backed by some of the top tech investors in the world.


Our products and services make it safe and easy for people and businesses to store, buy, use and learn about cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Our vision is to upgrade the world to a better financial system.


How we work


Our engineering team (currently 80 engineers) is split into organisations which we call Fleets. Each Fleet focuses on a core area of our product (consumer applications, business operations, new business, growth and marketing etc.). Each Fleet contains multiple smaller teams called Pods, each of which focuses on a specific aspect of that product. 


A pod will include a product owner, back-end engineers, Android and iOS developers, and web developers who each bring a unique perspective to the problem you are all contributing towards. Engineering Managers at Luno take ownership and manage at Fleet-level.


We're agile, use continuous integration and continuous delivery, deploying to production every single day.


What you'll do



  • Manage multiple teams of Software Engineers, totaling up to 15 direct line reports spread across London, Cape Town and Johannesburg

  • Attract, hire and grow exceptional Software Engineers

  • Provide leadership to your teams, including setting clear direction, and enabling alignment on strategy and business objectives (OKRs)

  • Oversee key projects, ensuring your teams deliver projects on time and with high quality

  • Work with Product Managers to plan and prioritise 

  • Serve your people - mentoring, coaching and growing your team members


Your first 90 days


You will start by flying to Cape Town for two weeks to learn our processes, meet the wider team and start our engineering onboarding program. After getting comfortable with the basics, you'll start learning our idiomatic patterns in a safe, easy-to-follow way - by building your own toy micro services. You'll get to practice how we do design docs, code reviews, deployments, events, logging and monitoring.


You’ll meet the Pods you’ll be leading and quickly align on the teams’ current OKRs and product roadmap. We succeed as a team, so we will provide you with regular feedback from your manager (Engineering Director) and peers (we currently have four Engineering Managers) and will encourage you to do the same.


As an experienced Engineering Manager, you’ll need



  • Experience in leading software engineering teams of 10+

  • A servant-leadership mentality

  • Strong experience with the OKR framework

  • Proven experience in hiring, growing software engineers, and performance management

  • A degree or equivalent working experience in a technical discipline (e.g. computing, mathematics, physics)

  • Experience writing code and designing software systems 

  • To exemplify the 10 Luno Moontality values


What’s in it for you?


We're providing a phenomenal opportunity to learn more about cryptocurrencies, blockchain, emerging markets, and together we'll work together to scale a global business.



  • You’ll work and lead multiple globally distributed teams.

  • You’ll gain experience working in a mobile-first fast scaling business with 3 million customers, handling billions of USD transactions, where quality and security come first.

  • We’ll provide you with support and learning opportunities to further develop as an engineering leader through our leadership development program, and access to thousands of Udemy courses.

  • We'll take care of lunch Monday - Thursday, and organise regular social events for team bonding.


Don’t be put off if you don’t tick all the boxes – they’re a guide based on what we’d love to see but we appreciate that excellent leaders have diverse backgrounds.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our London office has step-free access from the front door to your desk. You'll need to hold the legal right to work in the UK already as we cannot provide visa sponsorship.

items.title: Lead Application Engineer

items.content:
LiveSurface

Lead Application Engineer

LiveSurface is an industry leader in visualization and image creation tools for creatives. We blend leading technology with hand-curated content to provide realtime photorealistic visualization to our users. At our heart, we are a team of creatives that thrive on transforming challenging problems into beautifully implemented solutions. We are seeking a talented lead application engineer to join our team and help us to build the next generation of LiveSurface products. Interested in joining us? We’d love to hear from you. Lead Application Engineer What you’ll do: _ Build the next generation of LiveSurface visualization products. _ Work with the team to build a product roadmap and define milestones. _ Plan and research best technologies, pulling primarily from Apple Frameworks. _ Contribute to the overall product vision. _ Architect clean, reusable and maintainable modules. _ Leverage the latest frameworks (SwiftUI, Combine, Swift 5.x) to build new products. _ Work tightly with render engine lead to integrate and influence the render engine design. _ Refactor, optimize and pull from existing code from LiveSurface frameworks. _ Deliver beautiful, well implemented code that is performant and easy to understand. Who you are: _ A university graduate with an undergraduate degree or better. _ An experienced engineer with a minimum of 5 years working on UI code. _ A fast learner, able to adapt to new frameworks quickly. _ Experienced in creating iOS/macOS applications using Xcode. _ Up-to-date with the latest frameworks. _ Fluent in Swift, Objective-C and Apple Frameworks. _ Experienced in using Apple Frameworks to create custom experiences. _ An English speaker with strong communication skills. _ Equally good at architecting as you are with refactoring. _ Obsessed with clean, reusable modular architecture. _ Focused on workflow and user experience. We offer: _ Remote work and a flexible schedule. _ A wide range of challenging problems to solve. _ A stable, revenue-based structure with an existing product (on the market for 5+ years). _ Broad exposure: Your work will be seen and loved by thousands of users. _ A highly acclaimed platform with a loyal user base. _ A small, friendly, engineering team. _ Product-focused, non-corporate management. Extras that will make you stand out: _ A background in graphics and gaming. _ Knowledge of C, C++. _ Experience with using Adobe and other industry standard graphics tools. More about Context: http://www.livesurface.com/context.php

Développeur iOS confirmé - télétravail

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Creative Services, iOS, Mobile Application
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Tayasui | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Paris

Technologies

ios
macos

Job description

Avec le directeur créatif et le lead développeur, la tâches principale consistera en la maintenance de Tayasui Sketches et le développement de nouvelles applications. Vous travaillerez régulièrement sur les dernières APIs Apple que nous intégrons lors des mises à jour de iOS.

Caractéristiques du poste :
* Maintenance de notre App phare "Sketches".
* Avoir une attention particulière à l'expérience utilisateur
* Développer de nouvelles fonctionnalités sur les applications existantes.
* Développer de nouvelles applications.
* Rechercher et proposer des choix techniques optimums face aux problématiques rencontrées.

Indispensable : 
* Avoir une première expérience sur iOS
* Avoir un bon bagage mathématique (Bac +2)
* Être capable de reprendre des projets existants en objective C
* Un souci permanent de la qualité de l'expérience utilisateur
* Un bon relationnel vous permet de communiquer en cas de problème
* Responsable et autonome, vous êtes capables de mener à terme un projet

Optionnel :
* Connaître Unity
* Faire de la veille technologique, avoir des projets persos, animer un forum...

Nous offrons :
* La liberté de travailler d'où vous voulez
* L'opportunité de collaborer à des applications au rayonnement mondial
* Des projets variés et stimulants utilisant les derniers technologies d'Apple
* Le cadre d'une petite équipe dynamique et souple
* Un salaire attractif
* CDI ou CDD à temps plein ou partiel. Freelance, tout est envisageable

Apply now

About Tayasui

Tayasui, studio de création parisien, développe depuis 8 ans quelques-unes des applications les plus populaires et plébiscitées de l'App Store : Tayasui Sketches, Talking Carl, Blocks, Memopad...

Nous accordons une attention toute particulière à la qualité de l’expérience utilisateur et notre travail rigoureux autour de l’UI est à l’origine du succès mondial de nos Applications.

Votre intérêt pour l’UI et votre sensibilité pour le design seront de réels points forts pour intégrer notre équipe, avec qui vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration.

Benefits

  • La liberté de travailler d'où vous voulez
  • L'opportunité de travailler sur des Apps de rayonnement mondial
  • Des projets variés et stimulants utilisant les technologies Apple
  • Un salaire attractif
  • Le cadre d'une petite équipe dynamique et souple
  • Un travail à temps plein ou partiel

items.content:
Lead Application Engineer - Swift, UIKit/AppKit, Architecture, Data Model

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Advertising, Graphic Design, Visual Effects
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: LiveSurface | No office location

Technologies

swift
uikit
swiftui
objective-c
combine

Job description

LiveSurface is an industry leader in visualization and image creation tools for creatives. We blend leading technology with hand-curated content to provide realtime photorealistic visualization to our users. At our heart, we are a team of creatives that thrive on transforming challenging problems into beautifully implemented solutions.

We are seeking a talented lead application engineer to join our team and help us to build the next generation of LiveSurface products. Interested in joining us? We’d love to hear from you.

Lead Application Engineer

What you’ll do:
_ Build the next generation of LiveSurface visualization products.
_ Work with the team to build a product roadmap and define milestones.
_ Plan and research best technologies, pulling primarily from Apple Frameworks.
_ Contribute to the overall product vision.
_ Architect clean, reusable and maintainable modules.
_ Leverage the latest frameworks (SwiftUI, Combine, Swift 5.x) to build new products.
_ Work tightly with render engine lead to integrate and influence the render engine design.
_ Refactor, optimize and pull from existing code from LiveSurface frameworks.
_ Deliver beautiful, well implemented code that is performant and easy to understand.

Who you are:
_ A university graduate with an undergraduate degree or better.
_ An experienced engineer with a minimum of 5 years working on UI code.
_ A fast learner, able to adapt to new frameworks quickly.
_ Experienced in creating iOS/macOS applications using Xcode.
_ Up-to-date with the latest frameworks.
_ Fluent in Swift, Objective-C and Apple Frameworks.
_ Experienced in using Apple Frameworks to create custom experiences.
_ An English speaker with strong communication skills.
_ Equally good at architecting as you are with refactoring.
_ Obsessed with clean, reusable modular architecture.
_ Focused on workflow and user experience.

We offer:
_ Remote work and a flexible schedule.
_ A wide range of challenging problems to solve.
_ A stable, revenue-based structure with an existing product (on the market for 5+ years).
_ Broad exposure: Your work will be seen and loved by thousands of users.
_ A highly acclaimed platform with a loyal user base.
_ A small, friendly, engineering team.
_ Product-focused, non-corporate management.

Extras that will make you stand out:
_ A background in graphics and gaming.
_ Knowledge of C, C++.
_ Experience with using Adobe and other industry standard graphics tools.

More about Context:
http://www.livesurface.com/context.php


Apply now

About LiveSurface

LiveSurface was founded by an Apple alum designer/entrepreneur with 25+ years in the branding and design fields and 10+ years software engineering on macOS/iOS platforms.

Our small, talented team is distributed and lives in California, New York, Spain, Israel, Portugal, Germany. We love challenging problems and creating beautifully implemented solutions. We are split about evenly between engineering and content/marketing.

Our current customers include boutique design studios, well-know ad and design agencies and some of the biggest names in Silicon Valley tech.

Benefits

  • Remote work
  • Flexible schedule
  • Nice people
  • Collaborative workflow
  • Product-focused approach
